meanings.definition: A type of annelid worm, typically found in freshwater habitats.
meanings.sent1: The biologist studied the oligochaetes in the pond.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen often encounter oligochaetes while fishing in lakes.
meanings.sent3: The oligochaetes had a party in the stream, wiggling happily.
meanings.sent4: The oligochaetes in the soil worked tirelessly, like tiny gardeners.
meanings.sent5: Children were fascinated by the oligochaetes, squirming in the water.

meanings.definition: Organisms belonging to the class Oligochaeta, characterized by having few setae and lacking parapodia.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the oligochaetes under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Oligochaetes play a vital role in the ecosystem by breaking down organic matter.
meanings.sent3: The oligochaetes threw a parade to celebrate their lack of parapodia.
meanings.sent4: In the world of oligochaetes, having few setae was considered fashionable.
meanings.sent5: The oligochaetes moved gracefully, despite their lack of parapodia.
